medical_history.chief_complaint: Ongoing abdominal pain in the right upper quadrant (RUQ) and epigastric region following cholecystectomy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began after the cholecystectomy and have been ongoing since then. The patient reports the pain has been consistent and similar to prior episodes before undergoing the surgery. Denies vomiting but endorses nausea. Symptoms include lightheadedness and dizziness occasionally while sitting.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Possible TIA, Cholelithiasis with porcelain gallbladder, Hypertension (HTN), Hypothyroidism, Prior appendectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Father died at age after complication of gallbladder surgery; Mother died at unspecified age.
